name: Man-at-Arms Targeting Grid
desc:
Standard-issue targeting system installed on Krysan Navy ships. The Mark 19 Man-at-Arms Targeting Grid links with the ship's onboard sensors and synchronizes them to generate accurate target-tracking.

- Increases the range of small, medium, and large mounts by %s/%s/%s

- Increases the target lead and range of small ballistic PD turrets by %s (Does not stack with first modifier)

- Incompatible with %s
short: Standard-issue Krysan targeting system. Increases ballistic weapon range by %s|%s|%s and PD range by %s.

name: Black Rat Stealth Composites
desc: Utilizing an extensive suite of multispectral stealth composites, heatsinks, and signature masking, this craft is able to reduce its sensor profile by %s.
short: Stealthy rat. Decreases sensor profile by %s.

name: Bastion Shield System
desc:
Onboard shield generators have been tuned to maximize shield efficiency when directed to the ship's front and back. However, this makes the ship vulnerable from shots to the side as shields have to be stretched thin to compensate for the ship's length.

Increases shield arc to %s when turned to the sides, but decreases shield efficiency by %s
sModDesc:
Nullifies the shield efficiency debuff.
Buffs the shield unfold and turn rate by %s.

name: Ratfield Ballistics Computer
desc:
A Series 27 Ratfield Systems ballistics computer has been installed on this ship. Power Rat Units interlink with onboard sensors and provides dedicated processing to the onboard targeting system.

Damage to missiles increased by  %s | Improves target leading
short: PD unaffected by decoy flares, improved target leading, more damage to missiles.

name: Hyperspectral Camo Net
desc:
Rat use big net. Big net Cover biggest ship. Net good for hide. 
Depending on how small the ship type the fleet's sensor profile is reduced by 40/25/15/10
Effect does not stack with more copies of this hullmod.

name: Krysan Fervor
desc:
Krysan crew are known for their fervent behavior during battles, often displaying acts of bravery bordering on lunacy for the sake of victory. As battle-hardened folks, their ships tend to last longer in the heat of battle as Krysans ardently perform damage control whenever a lull in the fighting is found.

Repairs start once the ship's HP drops to %s and the ship's HP is quickly repaired by a max of %s/%s/%s/%s.

At %s hull, the ship engages emergency war power, increasing ship acceleration and deceleration by %s and turn speed by %s
short: Repairs hull and provides increased acceleration when on low health.
